intro: Echium cynoglossoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous small, oil-rich seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Echium cynoglossoides is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
